meanings.definition: Scuff (verb): To scrape or drag the feet while walking.
meanings.sent1: She scuffed her shoes on the pavement as she walked.
meanings.sent2: It is common to scuff your shoes when walking on rough surfaces.
meanings.sent3: He scuffed his shoes so much that they looked like they had been through a sandpaper factory.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden floor scuffed his shoes like a grumpy old man scolding a child.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her shoes scuffing against the ground echoed in the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: Scuff (noun): A mark or scrape on a surface caused by scraping or dragging.
meanings.sent1: There was a scuff on the floor where the chair had been dragged.
meanings.sent2: The scuff on the wall was a reminder of the moving day chaos.
meanings.sent3: The scuff on the table looked like a tiny battle scar from a fierce dinner party.
meanings.sent4: The scuff on the door told the story of many comings and goings.
meanings.sent5: The scuff on the car bumper was a small but visible imperfection.
